   {
     "sid": "56608",
     "Technique ID": "T1528",
     "Technique name": "Steal Application Access Token",
     "Quotes": ""Adversaries can steal application access tokens as a means of acquiring credentials to access remote systems and resources."",
     "Explanation": "The rule triggers when an attempt to establish a Cobalt Strike beacon inbound connection is detected. Cobalt Strike is a legitimate tool used for penetration testing, but it can also be abused by adversaries to establish a persistent presence on a compromised system and steal access tokens to other systems."
   },
   {
     "sid": "56608",
     "Technique ID": "T1132",
     "Technique name": "Data Encoding",
     "Quotes": ""Adversaries may encode data to make the content of command and control traffic more difficult to detect."",
     "Explanation": "The rule contains a fast_pattern signature that looks for the string ""{|22|meta|22|:{},|22|status|22|:|22|OK|22|,|22|saved|22|:|22|1|22|,|22|starttime|22|:17656184060,|22|id|22|:|22 22|,|22|vims|22|:{|22|dtc|22|:|22|"" within the file data. This pattern is commonly associated with Cobalt Strike beacons, which use data encoding to hide their malicious activities."
   },
   {
     "sid": "56608",
     "Technique ID": "T1059",
     "Technique name": "Command and Scripting Interpreter",
     "Quotes": ""Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries."",
     "Explanation": "Cobalt Strike can use various command and scripting interpreters, such as PowerShell, to execute malicious commands on a compromised system."
   },
   {
     "sid": "56608",
     "Technique ID": "T1133",
     "Technique name": "External Remote Services",
     "Quotes": ""Adversaries may leverage external-facing remote services to initially access and/or persist within a network."",
     "Explanation": "Cobalt Strike beacons communicate with a command and control server over the internet, which can be considered an external remote service."
   },
   {
     "sid": "56608",
     "Technique ID": "T1071",
     "Technique name": "Application Layer Protocol",
     "Quotes": ""Adversaries may communicate using OSI application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic."",
     "Explanation": "Cobalt Strike beacons use HTTP or HTTPS to communicate with the command and control server, which allows them to blend in with legitimate web traffic and evade detection."
   }
 ]
